column2: PENNSYLVANIA PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. You may turn right on red if you:
column8: stop first and check for traffic and pedestrians.
column10: have a right turn red arrow.

column2: 2. When you park on the roadway, you should:
3. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 4. If you are arrested for driving under the influence of alcohol and you refuse to take the blood test, you will receive a:
column4: sentence of one day in jail.
column8: government voucher for an alcohol addiction treatment.

column2: 5. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 6. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
7. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
8. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column6: they already are within the intersection.
column10: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a low place in the road.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 10. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column4: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 11. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your hands off the wheel
column6: take your eyes off the road
column8: take your attention away from driving

column2: 12. Driving at night is _______ than driving during the day.
13. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column6: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column8: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column10: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.

column2: 14. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
16. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column10: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 17. If there are no sidewalks, pedestrians should:
column4: walk in the direction of traffic.
column10: proceed in the direction of traffic until the next crosswalk.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column6: You must turn right at the next intersection
column8: Warning: the road ahead changes direction
column10: Warning: traffic coming from the right
